person.persName: Richard Oglesby (Union Colonel/ Major General, Illinois governor)

body.p: Fourteenth Governor of the State of Illinois. Floydsburg, Kentucky, native. 1st Lieutenant in the 4th Illinois Infantry on June 13, 1846 as a part of the Mexican-American war. Attended Louisville Law School in 1848. Moved to California in 1849 as a part of the California Gold Rush. Returned to Illinois in 1851. Early member of the Republican Party. Member of the Senate of the State of Illinois in 1860. Colonel of the 8th Illinois Infantry April 25, 1861. Promoted to Brigadier General on March 21, 1862 with the Army of the Tennessee. Promoted to Major General on November 29, 1862. Governor of Illinois from January 16, 1865 to January 11, 1869. Present in the room when Abraham Lincoln died on April 15, 1865.
